explanation:
- OS_impl_objtype_lock_table: The controlling expression if (impl == NULL) depends on the value read from this global array. To determine whether the test is invariant you must see the array definition and any static initializers (or guarantees that entries are always non-NULL). If every entry for all possible indices is statically non-NULL then the condition is invariant (always false).

- OS_impl_objtype_lock_t: The type of the array elements (and the pointed-at structure) is needed to confirm that impl is indeed a pointer type and to understand whether a NULL value is a valid/possible representation for an element. Also to check if any implementation details (e.g. const/volatile qualifiers) affect whether the value can change at runtime.

- osal_objtype_t: The index used to access the table (idtype) must be examined to ensure it ranges only over valid indices of OS_impl_objtype_lock_table. If idtype is an integer constant or restricted range that always maps to entries known-at-compile-time to be non-NULL, the if test could be invariant.

- OS_API_Impl_Init: This caller (and any code it runs) may initialize or populate OS_impl_objtype_lock_table before calling OS_Posix_TableMutex_Init. Inspecting the caller and its initialization sequence is necessary to determine whether the table entries are set to non-NULL (making the if test invariant) or left NULL/variable at the time of call.

Note: The do { ... } while (0); uses the literal 0 as the controlling expression. That is an integer constant expression and falls under MISRA's allowed exception for do-while constructs; no additional symbol is needed to justify that exception.
